content: give buttonnose crochet credit ©buttonnose crochet 2018 p ag e | 3 notes summer blossom can be made in any weight yarn using the hook size recommended for the yarn round 2 can be made 2 ways either with fpdc or bpdc invisible join is recommended if changing colours standing double_crochet and standing treble_crochet stitches are a great way to eliminate the starting chain for a row chain 4 slip_stitch to first chain to form a ring round 1 - colour 1 chain 3 counts as a double_crochet make 11 double_crochet into ring cut yarn fasten_off with ij 12 x double_crochet option 1 - flat centre round 2 - colour 2 standing fpdc around any double_crochet of round 1 chain 1 *fpdc around next st chain 1* repeat 10 more times fasten_off with ij 12 x fpdc 12 x chain 1 option 2 - raised centre round 2 - colour 2 standing bpdc around any double_crochet of round 1 chain 1 *bpdc around next st chain 1* repeat 10 more times fasten_off with ij 12 x bpdc 12 x chain 1 round 3 - colour 3 in any chain 1 space attach new colour stpc chain 2 *popcorn in next chain space chain 2* repeat 10 more times fasten_off with ij 12 x popcorn 12 x chain 2 round 4 - colour 4 in any chain 2 space attach new colour sttr chain 2 treble_crochet 2 double_crochet in same space *3 half_double_crochet next chain 2 space* 2 times 2 double_crochet treble_crochet chain 2 treble_crochet 2 double_crochet next chain 2 space repeat to 3 times omitting last corner group 2 double_crochet next to sttr slip_stitch to sttr slip_stitch to chain 2 space 2 x treble_crochet 4 x double_crochet 6 x half_double_crochet each side 4 x chain 2 corners round 5 - colour 4 chain 4 counts as double_crochet chain 2 2 double_crochet in same space *double_crochet in each st to corner 2 double_crochet chain 2 2 double_crochet in chain 2 corner* repeat 3 times omitting last corner group double_crochet next to starting chain 4 fasten_off with ij 16 x double_crochet each side 4 x chain 2 corners this pattern has been designed and written by natasha thorley of buttonnose crochet please do not share copy or redistribute this pattern you may sell your finished items but please give buttonnose crochet credit ©buttonnose crochet 2018 p ag e | 4 round 6 - colour 5 in any chain 2 corner attach new colour stdc chain 2 double_crochet in same space *bpdc around each st to corner double_crochet chain 2 double_crochet in chain 2 corner* repeat 3 times omitting last corner group fasten_off with ij 2 x double_crochet 16 x bpdc each side 4 x chain 2 corners sew in all ends and block square personally wet blocking is the only method i use soak your item in warm water for 30 mins roll excess water out between 2 towels pin to mats or on a blocking board and allow to dry this
